Posts.Content: Jun 27, 2012 02:31PM - edited Jun 28, 2012 10:20AM by sunedaze-52 same for me, felt fine after surgery.  Heard from the Drs office a little while ago, checking in and telling me how to take the bandage off tomorrow. yikes!!  Also that my results are in but the Dr has been in mtgs all day and will call me tomorrow, more waiting!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! ugh!  Hate this waiting game!  RESULTS CAME BACK FINE!!!
Posts.Title: Duct excision victoriah68 sunedaze-52

Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2012 03:39PM sunedaze-52 wrote: No, funny you asked that . . ., my son is in his last year of med school, when I texted him and said it was fine, he asked thats it, just fine???   I answered well,  benign.  I have an appt 7/24, I am sure she will go over it with me.  I am with you, I hate anesthesia, scares me too!!!!  So sorry you have had to go thru it soo many times.  This breast leakage has gone on over two years, finally thru in the towel and said ok, lets do it!  On a lighter note, you know how they go over your history, blah blah blah.  The last thing she says is, no nail polish.  Beep Beep Beep back the train up!!! I said I have fake nails . . do I need to snap them all off???  She couldn't answer me, lol  Luckly, my two index nails were broke, so they put the oxygen clip on one of them.  I feel so for you, its scary when you don't know the outcome, and if it will come back??  Please keep me informed, as I will you.
Posts.Title: Duct excision victoriah68 sunedaze-52

Posts.Content: Jul 19, 2012 02:45PM - edited Jul 28, 2012 08:28AM by sunedaze-52 hope all is going well!  I am healing up well, appt next Tues, hopefully noooo more operations!!!  SPOKE TOO SOON, STITCHES ARE INFECTED UGH!!!!!!  I GIVE UP!
Posts.Title: Duct excision victoriah68 sunedaze-52

Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2012 03:39PM sunedaze-52 wrote: so glad it went ok!  Its the waiting game!  I ended up at the Drs this morning . . . all swollen and bleeding, ugh!!  This is the first pain I really have had since the operation 6/25.  I have a hemotoma (spelling?), just going to take time to heal, very bruised.  They didn't think it was infected.  They said no more ibufrofen, alot of icing, great! Let me know how you are doing!
Posts.Title: Duct excision victoriah68 sunedaze-52

Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2012 01:49PM sunedaze-52 wrote: I ended up being re opened last Friday.  On the fourth I woke up with a very big & black breast.  Didn't want to bother to call Drs being the Fourth of July . . . , so I called Thursday morning.  They told me to come in to be checked.  Scared the heck out of the Dr, she said when did this happen!!!!  You should of called us!  The hemotoma would need to be drained and some irrigation done.   I said YOU GOT TO BE KIDDING!!!  I started to cry.  So sure enough Friday morning back under the knife, they took the stitches out, cleaned up and re stitched.  Its still pretty black, took the dressing of Monday.  It throbs a little but hoping I am on the mend.  Back for appt on the 24th.  They better not find anything else!!!  Geez, nothing like getting thru the initial operation fine and now this.  When I was reading up on this, that is one of the problems that can happen from the duct excision.  Great!!!  Thanks, for staying in touch!
Posts.Title: Duct excision victoriah68 sunedaze-52

Posts.Content: Jun 26, 2012 07:58AM sunedaze-52 wrote: Hello, I had my excisional biopsy on my right breast yesterday June 25th, now just the waiting game for the results  I have had on and off leakage for 2 years. I am a little nervous, had put off the biopsy last fall because the leaking had stopped.  I have had an MRI, multiple mamograms, sonograms, and ultra sounds. My doctor was ok with it then, but with my ultra sound last month, she urged me to seriously think about having it done.  Hoping the best for all of us!!
